questions.question: A CDL with passenger endorsement is required when operating a vehicle designed to transport how many passengers (including the driver)?
questions.explanation: Bus drivers must have a CDL if they drive a vehicle designed to seat 16 or more persons, including the driver.

questions.question: What emergency equipment must a bus have?
choices: Fire extinguisher and first aid kit
Fire extinguisher, reflectors, and spare fuses
First aid kit and emergency flashlight
questions.explanation: A bus must have a fire extinguisher and emergency reflectors (3 reflective triangles or at least 6 fusees or 3 liquid burning flares), plus spare electrical fuses unless equipped with circuit breakers.

questions.question: How many reflective triangles are required as emergency equipment?
questions.explanation: The bus must have 3 reflective triangles (or at least 6 fusees or 3 liquid burning flares).

questions.question: Where should standing passengers stay on a bus?
choices: In the front half of the bus
questions.explanation: No rider may stand forward of the rear of the driver's seat. All standing riders must stay behind the standee line.

questions.question: How wide is the standee line on a bus floor?
questions.explanation: Buses designed to allow standing must have a two-inch line on the floor showing riders where they cannot stand.

questions.question: What is the maximum total weight of hazardous materials that can be carried on a bus?
questions.explanation: Buses can carry no more than 500 pounds total of allowed hazardous materials.

questions.question: What is the maximum weight of any one class of hazardous material on a bus?
questions.explanation: No more than 100 pounds of any one class of hazardous material may be carried on a bus.

questions.question: How far from railroad crossings should a bus stop?
questions.explanation: Stop your bus between 15 and 50 feet before railroad crossings.

questions.question: At a drawbridge, how far back should you stop when there is no signal or attendant?
questions.explanation: Stop at least 50 feet before the draw of the bridge.

questions.question: What type of tires are prohibited on the front wheels of a bus?
questions.explanation: Front wheels must not have recapped or regrooved tires.

questions.question: Which hazardous materials can NEVER be carried on a bus?
choices: Poison gas or liquid Class 6 poison
questions.explanation: Buses must never carry Division 2.3 poison gas, liquid Class 6 poison, tear gas, or irritating materials.

questions.question: When are you NOT required to stop at a railroad crossing in a bus?
choices: When no train is visible in either direction
When a traffic signal is green or a flagman directs you
When other vehicles are crossing without stopping
You must always stop regardless of conditions
questions.explanation: You do not have to stop, but must slow down and carefully check, when a traffic signal is green or a policeman/flagman is directing traffic.

questions.question: When crossing railroad tracks in a bus with a manual transmission, you should:
choices: Shift into a higher gear for speed
Stop on the tracks if traffic ahead stops
questions.explanation: If your bus has a manual transmission, never change gears while crossing the tracks.

questions.question: What should you do before starting the bus after passengers have boarded?
choices: Check all mirrors and proceed normally
Wait for them to be seated or braced
Start moving slowly to signal departure
Close the doors and pull away promptly
questions.explanation: Wait for passengers to sit down or brace themselves before starting. Starting and stopping should be smooth to avoid rider injury.

questions.question: Where should you discharge a disruptive passenger?
choices: At the next scheduled stop only
questions.explanation: Don't discharge disruptive riders where it would be unsafe for them. It may be safer at the next scheduled stop or a well-lighted area where there are other people.

questions.question: Which of the following is a 'prohibited practice' for bus drivers?
choices: Fueling in a closed building with riders aboard
Running the air conditioning while idling
questions.explanation: Never refuel in a closed building with riders on board.

questions.question: When can you tow or push a disabled bus with passengers aboard?
choices: Only to the nearest safe spot to unload
Anytime if the driver deems it necessary
Only with dispatch approval and escort
questions.explanation: Do not tow or push a disabled bus with riders aboard unless getting off would be unsafe. Only tow or push to the nearest safe spot to discharge passengers.

questions.question: What is the brake-door interlock system?
choices: A lock preventing the door from opening while moving
Applies brakes and idles throttle when rear door opens
An alarm that sounds whenever any door is open
A backup brake that engages when parked at stops
questions.explanation: The brake-door interlock applies the brakes and holds the throttle in idle position when the rear door is open.

questions.question: Should you use the brake-door interlock in place of the parking brake?
choices: Yes, it's designed for that purpose
No, do not use it in place of the parking brake
Only when parked on level ground
questions.explanation: Do not use the brake-door interlock safety feature in place of the parking brake.

questions.question: What should you announce when arriving at a destination?
choices: The location and estimated arrival time
Location, stop reason, departure time, and bus number
Only the departure time and bus number
The location and any schedule changes
questions.explanation: When arriving at the destination or intermediate stops, announce: the location, reason for stopping, next departure time, and bus number.
